Name: relacl
Description: access privileges; see grant and revoke for details

Name: relam
Description: if this is an index, the access method used (b-tree, hash, etc.)

Name: relchecks
Description: number of check constraints on the table; see pg_constraint catalog

Name: relfilenode
Description: name of the on-disk file of this relation; 0 if none

Name: relfrozenxid
Description: all transaction ids before this one have been replaced with a permanent ("frozen") transaction id in this table. this is used to track whether the table needs to be vacuumed in order to prevent transaction id wraparound or to allow pg_clog to be shrunk. zero (invalidtransactionid) if the relation is not a table

Name: relhasindex
Description: true if this is a table and it has (or recently had) any indexes. this is set by create index, but not cleared immediately by drop index. vacuum clears relhasindex if it finds the table has no indexes

Name: relhasoids
Description: true if we generate an oid for each row of the relation

Name: relhaspkey
Description: true if the table has (or once had) a primary key

Name: relhasrules
Description: true if table has (or once had) rules; see pg_rewrite catalog

Name: relhassubclass
Description: true if table has (or once had) any inheritance children

Name: relhastriggers
Description: true if table has (or once had) triggers; see pg_trigger catalog

Name: relisshared
Description: true if this table is shared across all databases in the cluster. only certain system catalogs (such as pg_database) are shared

Name: relistemp
Description: true if this table is a temporary relation. if so, only the creating session can safely access its contents

Name: relkind
Description: r = ordinary table, i = index, s = sequence, v = view, c = composite type, t = toast table

Name: relname
Description: name of the table, index, view, etc.

Name: relnamespace
Description: the oid of the namespace that contains this relation

Name: relnatts
Description: number of user columns in the relation (system columns not counted). there must be this many corresponding entries in pg_attribute. see also pg_attribute.attnum

Name: reloptions
Description: access-method-specific options, as "keyword=value" strings

Name: relowner
Description: owner of the relation

Name: relpages
Description: size of the on-disk representation of this table in pages (of size blcksz). this is only an estimate used by the planner. it is updated by vacuum, analyze, and a few ddl commands such as create index

Name: reltablespace
Description: the tablespace in which this relation is stored. if zero, the database's default tablespace is implied. (not meaningful if the relation has no on-disk file.)

Name: reltoastidxid
Description: for a toast table, the oid of its index. 0 if not a toast table

Name: reltoastrelid
Description: oid of the toast table associated with this table, 0 if none. the toast table stores large attributes "out of line" in a secondary table

Name: reltuples
Description: number of rows in the table. this is only an estimate used by the planner. it is updated by vacuum, analyze, and a few ddl commands such as create index

Name: reltype
Description: the oid of the data type that corresponds to this table's row type, if any (zero for indexes, which have no pg_type entry)
